sen.j: 野村万作（二世）（狂言師、1931年6月22日 -）は東京生まれ。
sen.e: Mansaku NOMURA (the second) (a kyogen performer, June 22, 1931 -) was born in Tokyo.
Mansaku NOMURA (the second) (a kyogen performer, June 22, 1931 -) was born in Tokyo.
Mansaku NOMURA (the second) (a kyogen performer, June 22, 1931 -) was born in Tokyo.

sen.j: 本名：二朗
sen.e: Real name: Jiro. Graduated from Tokyo Metropolitan Koishikawa High School, and Waseda University.
sen.cmt: 文章の構造から、一文にまとめることができませんでした。
sen.e: Real name: Jiro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Real name: Jiro.

sen.j: 東京都立小石川高等学校、早稲田大学卒業。
sen.e: Graduated from Tokyo Metropolitan Koishikawa High School, and Waseda University.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Graduated from Tokyo Metropolitan Koishikawa High School, and Waseda University.

sen.j: 「万作の会」主宰。
sen.e: He presides over the 'Mansaku no kai' (the kyogen performance group).
He presides over the 'Mansaku no kai' (the kyogen performance group).
He presides over the 'Mansaku no kai' (the kyogen performance group).

sen.j: 「釣狐」を計26回も演じて磨き上げたことでも知られる。
sen.e: He is known for having refined the work titled 'Tsuri kitsune' (Fox Trapping) by performing it for 26 times.
He is known for having refined the work titled 'Tsuri kitsune' (Fox Trapping) by performing it for 26 times.
He is known for having refined the work titled 'Tsuri kitsune' (Fox Trapping) by performing it for 26 times.

sen.j: 昭和40年代には、ネスカフェの「ネスカフェゴールドブレンド」のCMでお茶の間に認知された。
sen.e: During the period from 1965-1974, he became popular among the general public due to his appearance in a commercial message of 'NESCAFÉ Gold Blend,' a product by NESCAFÉ.
During the period from 1965-1974, he became popular among the general public due to his appearance in a commercial message of 'NESCAFÉ Gold Blend,' a product by NESCAFÉ.
During the period from 1965-1974, he became popular among the general public due to his appearance in a commercial message of 'NESCAFÉ Gold Blend,' a product by NESCAFÉ.

sen.j: 重要無形文化財総合指定者。
sen.e: The general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.
The general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.
The general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.

sen.j: 故六世野村万蔵の次男であり、3歳で初舞台を踏む。
sen.e: He is the second son of the late Manzo NOMURA, the sixth, and debuted at the age of 3.
He is the second son of the late Manzo NOMURA, the sixth, and debuted at the age of 3.
He is the second son of the late Manzo NOMURA, the sixth, and debuted at the age of 3.

sen.j: 1950年、万作を襲名。
sen.e: He succeeded the professional name, Mansaku, in 1950.
He succeeded the professional name, Mansaku, in 1950.
He succeeded the professional name, Mansaku, in 1950.

sen.j: 戦後の伝統芸能不遇の時代から狂言の普及に努め、広く支持を集めている。
sen.e: He has been striving to spread kyogen since after the war which was the dark days for traditional performing arts, and received broad support.
He has been striving to spread kyogen since after the war which was the dark days for traditional performing arts, and received broad support.
He has been striving to spread kyogen since after the war which was the dark days for traditional performing arts, and received broad support.

sen.j: 芸術祭 (文化庁)大賞、日本芸術院賞、紀伊國屋演劇賞、紫綬褒章、坪内逍遥大賞など受賞多数。
sen.e: He won many awards such as Arts Festival (Japanese Agency for Cultural Affairs) Grand Prize, Award of the Japan Art Academy, The Kinokuniya Theater Prize, Shiju hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon) and Shoyo TSUBOUCHI's Prize.

He won many awards such as Arts Festival (Japanese Agency for Cultural Affairs) Grand Prize, Award of the Japan Art Academy, The Kinokuniya Theater Prize, Shiju hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon) and Shoyo TSUBOUCHI's Prize.

He won many awards such as Arts Festival (Japanese Agency for Cultural Affairs) Grand Prize, Award of the Japan Art Academy, The Kinokuniya Theater Prize, Shiju hosho (medal of honor with purple ribbon) and Shoyo TSUBOUCHI's Prize.

sen.j: 2007年、重要無形文化財（人間国宝）認定。
sen.e: In 2007, he was certified as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
In 2007, he was certified as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
In 2007, he was certified as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).

sen.j: 兄に野村萬（七世野村万蔵）。
sen.e: He has an older brother, Man NOMURA (Manzo NOMURA, the seventh).
He has an older brother, Man NOMURA (Manzo NOMURA, the seventh).
He has an older brother, Man NOMURA (Manzo NOMURA, the seventh).

sen.j: 弟に野村四郎、野村万之介。
sen.e: His younger brothers are Shiro NOMURA and Mannosuke NOMURA.
His younger brothers are Shiro NOMURA and Mannosuke NOMURA.
His younger brothers are Shiro NOMURA and Mannosuke NOMURA.

sen.j: 妹ひとり。
sen.e: He also has a younger sister.
He also has a younger sister.
He also has a younger sister.

sen.j: 著書に「太郎冠者を生きる」（白水社）がある。
sen.e: He authored a book, "Taro-kaja wo ikiru" (living as the leading actor of kyogen) (published by Hakusuisha Publishing Co., Ltd.).
He authored a book, "Taro-kaja wo ikiru" (living as the leading actor of kyogen) (published by Hakusuisha Publishing Co., Ltd.).
He authored a book, "Taro-kaja wo ikiru" (living as the leading actor of kyogen) (published by Hakusuisha Publishing Co., Ltd.).

sen.j: 狂言を中心に多彩な活動を行っている野村萬斎は息子。
sen.e: Mansai NOMURA, who is engaged in kyogen and other various activities and performances, is his son.
Mansai NOMURA, who is engaged in kyogen and other various activities and performances, is his son.

sen.j: 1934年 「靫猿」で初舞台
sen.e: 1934 Debuted with the work titled 'Utsubozaru' (The Quiver Monkey).
1934 Debuted with the work titled 'Utsubozaru' (The Quiver Monkey).

sen.j: 1950年 万作襲名。
sen.e: 1950 Succeeded the professional name, Mansaku.
1950 Succeeded the professional name, Mansaku.
1950 Succeeded the professional name, Mansaku.

sen.j: 「三番叟」「奈須与市語」を被く。
sen.e: Mastered 'Sanbaso' (a dance dedicated to the shrine and performed as a Japanese-styled three dolls, Chitose, Okina and Sanbaso, operated by three doll handlers) and 'Nasu no Yoichi no katari' (The Tale of NASU no Yoichi).

Mastered 'Sanbaso' (a dance dedicated to the shrine and performed as a Japanese-styled three dolls, Chitose, Okina and Sanbaso, operated by three doll handlers) and 'Nasu no Yoichi no katari' (The Tale of NASU no Yoichi).

sen.j: 1956年 「釣狐」を被く。
sen.e: 1956 Mastered 'Tsuri kitsune' (Fox Trapping).

sen.j: 1960年 「花子」を被く。
sen.e: 1960 Mastered 'Hanako.'

sen.j: 1978年 芸術祭大賞受賞。
sen.e: 1978 Won the Arts Festival Grand Prize.
1978 Won the Arts Festival Grand Prize.

sen.j: 1979年 紀伊国屋演劇賞受賞。
sen.e: 1979 Won the Kinokuniya Theater Prize.
1979 Won the Kinokuniya Theater Prize.

sen.j: 1982年 芸術祭優秀賞受賞。
sen.e: 1982 Won the Arts Festival Excellence Award.
1982 Won the Arts Festival Excellence Award.

sen.j: 1986年 法政大学観世寿夫能楽賞を受賞。
sen.e: 1986 Won the Hosei University, Kanze Hisao's Noh play Prize.
1986 Won the Hosei University, Kanze Hisao's Noh play Prize.

sen.j: 「狸腹鼓」を被く。
sen.e: Mastered 'Tanuki no haratsuzumi' (a story of a raccoon and a huntsman).

sen.j: 1990年 日本芸術院賞受賞。
sen.e: 1990 Won the Award of the Japan Art Academy.

sen.j: 1995年 紫綬褒章受章。
sen.e: 1995 Won the 'Shiju hosho' (medal of honor).

sen.j: 2003年 ベスト・ファーザー イエローリボン賞受賞。
sen.e: 2003 Won the Best Father Yellow ribbon Prize.

sen.j: 2006年 朝日賞受賞。
sen.e: 2006 Won the Asahi Prize.

sen.j: 2007年 人間国宝認定に、文化審議会が文部科学相に答申。
sen.e: 2007 Council for Cultural Affairs reported to Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology for certifying Mansaku NOMURA as Living National Treasure.

sen.j: 2008年 練馬区名誉区民に選定。

sen.j: 長谷川伸賞受賞。
sen.e: Won the Shin HASEGAWA's Prize.
